result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Nash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder - Substantial Battery PTAC, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  No contact w/immediate family of A.I. or A.P including their parents, children, siblings, etc.  Attend AA or NA or similar support groups meetings.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of extended supervision

Defendant Christopher L. Nash in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg and intern Amy S..  Defendant Christopher L. Nash in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty's state appearances and status.  Court has reviewed the sentencing memorandum and PSI.  Atty. Hoffman plays video of Inman's children.  P.I. (Aunt of A.I. on behalf of sister T.D.) makes statement.   P.I. (A.I.'s mother) makes statement.  State makes argument.  Impose 18 1/2 yrs. (12 yrs. prison & 6 1/2 yrs. ES) with all conditions the agent recommended.  Atty. Schulenburg makes argument 5 yrs. prison & 5 yrs. ES.  Defendant makes statement.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 4:
WI State Prison for 15 years (9 years Initial Confinement/6 years Extended Supervision)  
796 days credit
Submit to DNA Sample
No contact w/immediate family of A.I. or A.P. including their parents, children, siblings, etc. 
Absolute Sobriety from both alcohol & drugs
No possession of controlled substances unless valid Rx.
Not on any premises of taverns, bars, liquor stores where the primary sales is alcohol
Full time employment/schooling or combination of both
Attend AA or NA or similar support groups
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 7, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher L. Nash in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Defendant Christopher L. Nash in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Plea to Count 4 felony murder - w/substantial battery PTAC.  State may argue any and up to 12 years.  Counts 1-3 dismissed but read in.  State requests ordering a PSI.  Court questions as to Count 4 substantial battery w/PTAC or just substantial battery to whom.  Atty. Schulenburg states A.P.  Off record.  Parties have now redone amended information.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 4. Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court. State and Atty. Schulenburg are fine with the plea collaque with defendant.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Bond to remain as is.  Report to be done by Nov. 17th.  

Counts 1-3:  Dismissed but read in  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on September 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher L. Nash in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Defendant Christopher L. Nash in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond.  Atty Schulenburg states position and gives statements of events from the evening and requests $5,000 cash bond.  State states their position to keep previous bond ordered.  Court orders $10,000 Cash bond.  If bond is posted special conditions apply as follows:  No contact with A.P. or his family.  No contact with the A.I.'s family.  May not leave the State of WI and may not travel beyond the borders of Sauk County or any surrounding counties.  Absolute sobriety.  No violent or abusive contact with anyone.  No contact with the co-defendants, Jae Robinson, Matthew Harvey or Amanda Rotar.  Must personally report to the Sauk County LEC every Wednesday and Saturday between 6:30 - 8:30 p.m.  Must abide by a 9:00 p.m. curfew every night and 7:00 a.m. every morning.  Court schedules 2 week trial.  Court to prepare a revised scheduling order.  Jury trial scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 24, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on September 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
3rd motion to modify bail
Cover Letter from Atty. Schulenburg

Defendant Christopher L. Nash in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Defendant Christopher L. Nash in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing on speedy trial demand.  Atty. Schulenburg withdraws request for speedy trial.  Atty. Hoffman states talked with victims family and they do not wish to have this delayed.  State agreed with Berkos with Robinson go first and Nash go 2nd if trial.  Victims agree with that as well.  Victims/family want closure.  Court will take trial off for July and will set scheduling with other atty.s especially Atty. Covey with Robinson's case to go first and set trial.  Motion for change of venue still unaddressed.  Atty. Schulenburg states about the publicity of the first trial if need change of venue.  Atty. Schulenburg prefers to leave motion open.  Deadlines for motions are voided. Court removes motion hearing in June and trial.  Court will reset as needed.
Hearing on May 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher L. Nash in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Defendant Christopher L. Nash in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court review motion and doesn't feel has authority for pre trial holdings.  Court denies motion.  Atty. Schulenburg will take different direction.  Court sites 2nd motion.  Atty. Schulenburg would like to give testimony.  Court is statisfied with motion pleadings, no testimony needed.   Atty. Schulenburg makes further argument of bail.  Excessive amount.  Atty. Hoffman makes argument - history, will leave State, not excessive.  Court sites an appeal case and Court denies 2nd motion to modify bail.

Defendant Christopher L. Nash in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Defendant Christopher L. Nash in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hoffman calls Det.  George Bonham - BPD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE Rotar.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Nash.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Harvey.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Covey stipulates to the ID of his client DE Robinson.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Atty Berkos does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Schulenburg does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Newton does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Covey does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  State has no questions and the witness is excused.  Defense attorney's have no witnesses at this time.  State waives argument.  Atty Berkos states argument.  Atty Schulenburg states argument.  Atty Newton states argument.  Atty Covey states argument.  Court finds as to each of the four DE's that there is probable cause to believe a felony was committed and binds them all over for trial.  Court addresses motion for bond modification filed by Atty Newton.  Atty Newton agrees to have that heard at a later date.  Atty Hoffman files a stipulation as to Nash's case and Robinson's case.  Atty Hoffman requests hearing be set in re: to the release of the victim.  Atty Berkos responds re: release of the body.  States he would like to review the autopsy report prior to making a decision.  State is aware of the objection.  Court states they will be in touch w/the State and Atty Berkos to set a hearing date/time.  Atty Covey notes that the RD on 11/3/2015 will likely not be necessary and an arraignment will be set at a later date and time.  Court says matter will remain on the calendar for now but doesn't believe all four if any of the DE's will be here for that date.
Return of officer Nate Lund; Search Warrant; and Affidavit of Warrant dated 4/13/16
Return of officer M. Pichler; Search Warrant; and Affidavit of Warrant dated 4/13/16

Preliminary hearing at 10-14-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 11-03-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher L. Nash appeared by video means from LEC with atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State amends complaint to A.P. not A.R. Court so amends.  State requests $100,000.00 Cash bond and gives history of DE.  Atty. ORourke gives bail argument and requests PA bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $50,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact coactors J.R., M.H. or A.R.; Not leave State of WI; No contact w/surviving victim A.P.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
